dmca.title: Appropriating Animal Artwork
dmca.body:
[private]
Art By [private]
[private]
Monroeville, PA 15146

July 26, 2005

Dear [private]:

It has come to my attention that you have made an unauthorized use of my copyrighted work entitled

is essentially identical to the Work and clearly used the Work as its basis. This includes attempting to sell originals of the works, and making prints. This includes selling on venues such as Ebay, Art.com, etc.

As you neither asked for nor received permission to use the Work as the basis for

ANDALUSIAN HORSE
BLACK COCKER SPANIEL

nor to make or distribute copies, including electronic copies, of same, I believe you have willfully infringed my rights under 17 U.S.C. Section 101 et seq. and could be liable for statutory damages as high as $150,000 as set forth in Section 504(c)(2) therein.
I demand that you immediately cease the use and distribution of all infringing works derived from the Work, and all copies, including electronic copies, of same, that you deliver to me, if applicable, all unused, undistributed copies of same, or destroy such copies immediately and that you desist from this or any other infringement of my rights in the future. 

If I have not received an affirmative response from you by August 12, 2005, indicating that you have fully complied with these requirements, I shall take further action against you.

Very truly yours,

[private]
The Critter Connection

Cc:

[private]
Attorney at Law
Corley, Davidson & Huie, PLLC
[private]
Knoxville, TN  37929
